Text:
The 10 richest Americans doubled their wealth during pandemic. 

The system is rigged for those at the top.

At no time in my life since the Civil Rights movement have voting rights been under attack as they are today.

We must save out democracy before it’s too late.
I don’t know who needs to hear this, but trickle down economics is nothing more than a cruel hoax designed to enrich the wealthy and corporations at the expense of the American people.

Why are prices rising?

Not wage increases. Not the safety net. It's the concentration of the U.S. economy into the hands of a few corporate giants with the power to raise prices. 

Consider: Profit margins at large corporations are now at a 70-year high. https://t.co/AnYwAICcAb

America’s trend toward higher profits, higher share prices, mounting executive pay, but near stagnant wages is unsustainable.

IMHO, corporate taxes should be lower on corporations that share profits with all their workers, and higher on those that don't. https://t.co/9LsiZg988N

Forced overtime is commonplace. Wage theft is in the tens of billions every year. Full-time employees are routinely misclassified as independent contractors to cut pay and strip benefits.

Worker exploitation in this country is out of control. https://t.co/lZW2yjC1jK
PSA: The Trump coup never ended. In 2021, more than 440 voter suppression bills were introduced in 29 states. The attempt to upend our democracy is very much ongoing.

Less than two weeks ago, Joe Manchin remarked, “We act like we’re going to obstruct people from voting. That’s not going to happen.”

Hello? Black voters accounted for half of all ballot application rejections in Georgia. People of color are being disenfranchised as we speak. https://t.co/WtH1z5ZFCR
Refusing to wear a mask does not make you "free," in the same way that refusing to wear a seat belt does not make you free. Why has something this simple become this controversial?
By the way, why does the media always focus on the costs of tackling big problems but never on the costs of doing nothing about them? https://t.co/PtyqtWCK02
If the bottom 90% of Americans own just 11% of stocks, is the stock market really an accurate reflection of the economy?

Starbucks calls its workers “partners” but they’re not partners because they don’t share in the profits. 

Its CEO raked in $14.7 million last year, but the company continues to keep wages in the basement.

"Social responsibility" my macchiato. https://t.co/BfqZuaFh9i

The forces undermining our democracy are counting on you to give up. Cynicism is how they win. Do not, under any circumstances, give up on voting rights. Here are 8 ways we can still protect them. https://t.co/SrQW7ZSlJl
Today, on Holocaust Remembrance Day, we must fight back against the GOP’s authoritarian agenda by committing to educating ourselves, and our children, about the full horrors of the Holocaust.

Let’s be clear: educating our children about the full terror of the Holocaust is not “promoting” it.

If we don’t accurately teach this history to future generations, we're doomed to repeat it. Remember: the Holocaust started with Nazis banning books and cracking down on speech. https://t.co/CDkh2PFWz0

Leadership, by definition, does not cater to the center. If it did, there would be no need to lead.

America's visionary leaders have always understood that the “center” is a fictitious place lying somewhere south of thoughtless adherence to the status quo.https://t.co/dvGGfcmrkG

Will escalating tensions w/ Russia put the final nail in the coffin on Build Back Better? History says yes, but it’s not too late. It’s up to all of us to fight against the military-industrial complex & hold this administration accountable for its promises to the American people.

It’s not just the hypocrisy about defense spending vs. domestic spending that’s concerning.

The mere threat of warfare often ends periods of domestic reform.

WWI brought the progressive era to a halt. WWII ended FDR’s New Deal. The Vietnam War put a stop to LBJ's Great Society.

House Dems are fast-tracking a massive defense spending bill for Ukraine as tensions with Russia escalate, leaving no opportunity for debate.

Where is the CBO score? The cries about inflation? Concerns about the deficit?

Hello? Why does none of that matter when it comes to war?
Before Republicans try to obstruct Biden's Supreme Court nominee, let us all remember that the GOP rammed through Amy Coney Barrett's confirmation a mere 8 days before the election.

The underlying problem is not inflation. It’s corporate power. The entire American economy is concentrated into the hands of a few greedy, corporate giants with the power to raise prices.

Know the truth. https://t.co/VIxhBXuMmm
Who else thinks we need a vocal opponent of Citizens United on the Supreme Court?

I just heard Joe Manchin say Biden has to move to the “center.” Rubbish. There is no middle ground between lies and facts. There is no halfway point between civil discourse and violence. There is no midrange between democracy and fascism. https://t.co/dvGGfcE2Jg
https://t.co/EobW2gDsWK
Not so fun fact: Members of Congress and their immediate families traded more than $620 million worth of stocks and other assets last year. Why in the world is that legal? https://t.co/L3lj88F6Ac
Follow @SBWorkersUnited for updates! https://t.co/Py7n7yvFf4

Late last year, Starbucks workers in Buffalo formed the first Starbucks union in the U.S.

Now 30+ Starbucks stores are petitioning for union elections.

Just this week, two Starbucks stores in Seattle — home to Starbucks HQ — announced plans to unionize.

This is truly historic.

Reminder: The GOP blocked Merrick Garland’s nomination for 293 days.

Trump offered Amy Coney Barrett the Supreme Court nomination on the same day he met with her, less than 72 hours after RBG's death.

They'll do everything they can to block Biden's nominee.

Buckle up.

Speaking of the Supreme Court, here are 5 ideas for how to make it more accountable to the people:

1) Enact term limits
2) Enforce ethics standards
3) Require financial disclosures
4) Expand the court
5) Rotate justices https://t.co/JremrBa4ik
Who would you like to replace Justice Breyer on the Supreme Court?

The media wants you to think that the fight for voting rights is a “Democrats vs Republicans” issue. Rubbish.

This is Republicans vs democracy. Let's hope they start to get this right.
What about Barack Obama for the Supreme Court? There's precedent: William Howard Taft was President (from 1909-1913) and later served on the Supreme Court (1921-1930).

Regardless of whom Biden nominates to replace Breyer, the right will attack with everything it has. Ever since Robert Bork’s nomination, SCOTUS appointments have provided a vehicle for the most extreme and bitter forms of partisan warfare.

Buckle up.

https://t.co/P3ICPtwJyM
https://t.co/4cyIbcJw9y

As the pandemic killed hundreds of thousands in this country, at least 75 lawmakers bought and sold stock in companies that make COVID-19 vaccines, treatments, and tests.

It is ludicrous that this is not illegal.

As if we didn’t have enough to worry about, the leaders of the two largest nuclear-armed nations are now engaged in what appear to be preparations for war.

So...what can be done to prevent it?

Swing by at 10am PT to join our Office Hours conversation: https://t.co/283oKlvXHn

I always chuckle when the GenZ's I teach tell me, a Boomer, that "life is too short" to devote your whole life to work. But I get it.
https://t.co/sQnFC2PeP7

25 Democrats and two Republicans just signed a letter calling on Nancy Pelosi and Kevin McCarthy to ban members of Congress from trading individual stocks.

Momentum is building.

We need to continue getting loud about this. https://t.co/prTb8vLlzN

Congratulations to my friends @SolanaRice and @JeremieGreer for launching their new podcast - a thoughtful, insightful look at how we can dismantle the oppression economy and build economic power for people of color. I highly recommend a listen, and a share! https://t.co/OVcyHZqVPb
How can we call workers essential if we won't even pay them a living wage? Hello?
If you think 2021 was the year workers got fed up and flexed their collective muscle, just wait until you see what working people will accomplish in 2022. https://t.co/qlRpov023v

Kroger ended hazard pay barely two months into the pandemic, while posting record profits and shelling out $22.4M to its CEO.

Congratulations to the @UFCW_7 workers who took to the picket line to demand fair pay and dignified working conditions—and won. Worker power is powerful. https://t.co/HbgZ88aYj8
